poem.title: for Ian Colclough
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Was it the drowning eight years later Memorised that first attempt At verse "Too late, he's dead!" the bosun cried; Sorrowful silence was our reply. I hear a swizz, a ripple, something Awful in that latter line. - But I've done worse since, and a good friend lies Twenty-eight years under, as I live.
